column5:
Persist Elasticsearch data by default via named volume (#430)

* Persist Elasticsearch data by default via named volume

* update volume declaration to long format

* Update README

Update Swarm stack to 7.2.1

Increase delay before password setup in Swarm test
Update links to sources of base images

doc: Point users to important system configurations

Closes #415
Make APM server listen on non-loopback interfaces (#414)

APM extension: update path to apm-server config

Closes #411

Fix path to APM server extensions onfig

Fixes #411
doc: Add and clarify information about security

Add default credentials to APM server extension

Fixes #411
doc: Add links to "Configure * on Docker" pages

doc: Give a realistic estimate of Kibana startup time

Closes #407

Quote strings in Logstash pipeline config

Closes #408

doc: Fix incorrect usage of logstash_system user

Closes #405

Travis: Return exit code of spawned process in password setup script

Also bump stack version in stack file.
Travis: improve robustness of readiness checks

Enable Stack Features (X-Pack) and trial by default (#387)

Co-authored-by: Willian Soares <willian@unidesk.com.br>

Add APM server extension (#326)

Why:
* Adds Elasticsearch Application Performance Monitoring extension
* Can view application traces, errors and alerts trough Kibana

How:
* Add extension for apm-server container to the network which will receive traffic on port 8200 and report to elastic search server at port 9200

Revert "Revert "Set ELK components version from .env file" (#206)" (#303)

This reverts commit 8f5b242d6a51615899ae920cc420b6393853ebcd.

branding: Rename ELK to Elastic stack

https://www.elastic.co/elk-stack
Point badge link to update PR
Shared drives hint for Docker for Windows users (#259)

Create index pattern via Kibana API

Closes #216

Update version to 6.1.0 (#212)



Updated the version of the docker image tags to 6.1.0 and bumped
the version of the ELK badge

The badge link to the pull request was not updated to reflect the
current pull request's number
Fix typos in Compose and Travis files

Includes required change for logstash config and disables the new machine learning functionality in x-pack by default.

Decrease default Heap size and update doc

add link to searchguard branch in README

Fix line endings issue of shell script files on Windows

Merge pull request #55 from michaeltarleton/feature/allow-logstash-plugin-management

Feature: how-to logstash plugin management
Removed the json plugin example from the logstash config.
Removed the json plugin and updated the README.
Updated README with the new additions.
Installed and configured the logstash-filter-json filter for message parsing in JSON out of the box.

Remove useless entrypoint for Elasticsearch container

Added a note about the logstash indice creation.
Close #49.

Merge pull request #42 from minhdanh/master

Fix error "[9] System error: not a directory"

Fix error "[9] System error: not a directory"

When starting the stack `with docker-compose up`, it gives out the error:

```
ERROR: Cannot start container e032695b38cdcd1c72597004f2369a7127b8233c9ecc2320c3b2bbd10209654b: [9] System error: not a directory
```

Merge pull request #29 from fvigotti/patch-1

kibana is now executed using exec

kibana is now executed using exec

kibana should be executed with exec to give it pid 1 and bind signal forwarding with the container instance
Removed Marvel. Marvel suport is now integrated in another branch.

Updated documentation section related to Elasticsearch data persistence.
Close #19

Reverted network.host option from _non_loopback_ to 0.0.0.0.
Close #18
Use Elasticseach 2.x, Logstash 2.x and latest Kibana version.
